meanings.definition: To have the shape or characteristics of an eagle.
meanings.sent1: The kite eagled gracefully in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The toy eagle eagled majestically above the trees.
meanings.sent3: The paper eagle eagled playfully in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her dance eagled across the stage with elegance.
meanings.sent5: The model eagle eagled with lifelike precision.

meanings.definition: To score an eagle in golf.
meanings.sent1: He eagled the final hole to win the tournament.
meanings.sent2: She eagled the difficult par-5 with a perfect shot.
meanings.sent3: The golfer eagled the course, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His putt eagled into the hole, sealing his victory.
meanings.sent5: They eagled the round, celebrating their success.

meanings.sent1: She eagled the birds in the park with her binoculars.
meanings.sent2: The detective eagled the suspect's every move.
meanings.sent3: He eagled the movie, noticing every detail.
meanings.sent4: The teacher eagled the students during the test.
meanings.sent5: They eagled the sunset, taking in every color.
